articles.title: Explained: What is the West Nile Virus, how does it spread? - The Indian Express
articles.description: The West Nile Virus is a mosquito-borne, single-stranded RNA virus. According to the WHO, it is “a member of the flavivirus genus and belongs to the Japanese Encephalitis antigenic complex of the family Flaviviridae”.
